net.semanticmetadata.lire.matrix

Interface DistanceMatrix

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    FastmapDistanceMatrix
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    ArrayFastmapDistanceMatrix, NocacheFastmapDistanceMatrix

    public interface DistanceMatrix
    Date: 07.02.2005 Time: 22:10:54
    Author:
    Mathias Lux, mathias@juggle.at

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int getDimension()
      Returns the dimension of the matrix
      double getDistance(int index1, int index2)
      Calculates the distance between objects using the distance function for k = 0, using DistanceCalculator.getDistance(Object, Object).

      Calculates the distance between objects using the distance function for k = 0, using DistanceCalculator.getDistance(Object, Object).
      int getIndexOfObject(java.lang.Object o)
      Returns the index in the matrix of the given user object or -1 if not found

    • Method Detail

      • getDistance

        double getDistance(java.lang.Object o1,
                 java.lang.Object o2)
        Calculates the distance between objects using the distance function for k = 0, using DistanceCalculator.getDistance(Object, Object). If it has not been computed previously it is computed and stored now.
        Parameters:
        o1 - Object 1 to compute
        o2 - Object 2 to compute
        Returns:
        the distance as float from [0, infinite)

      • getDistance

        double getDistance(int index1,
                 int index2)
        Calculates the distance between objects using the distance function for k = 0, using DistanceCalculator.getDistance(Object, Object). If it has not been computed previously it is computed and stored now.
        Parameters:
        index1 - index of first object to compute
        index2 - index of second object to compute
        Returns:
        the distance as float from [0, infinite)

      • getMaximumDistance

        int getMaximumDistance(int row)
        Used for the heuristic for getting the pivots as described in the paper. This method calls with parameters (row, 0, null, null).
        Parameters:
        row - defines the row where we want to find the maximum
        Returns:
        the index of the object with maximum distance to the row object.

      • getDimension

        int getDimension()
        Returns the dimension of the matrix
        Returns:
        dimension, which is > 0

      • getUserObject

        java.lang.Object getUserObject(int rowNumber)
        Returns the user object for given index number
        Parameters:
        rowNumber -
        Returns:
        See Also:
        getIndexOfObject(Object)

      • getIndexOfObject

        int getIndexOfObject(java.lang.Object o)
        Returns the index in the matrix of the given user object or -1 if not found
        Parameters:
        o - the object to search for
        Returns:
        the index number of the object or -1 if not found
        See Also:
        getUserObject(int)

      • getSimilarityMatrix

        SimilarityMatrix getSimilarityMatrix()
        Creates and returns a newly created similarity Matrix from the given distance Matrix
        Returns:
        the similarityMatrix or null if not implemented or possible
